intro: Isonandra perakensis var. kelantanensis, commonly known as the Kelantan isonandra, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has simple, opposite leaves with a smooth surface and a slightly waxy texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
